thread.title: Man City boss Pep Guardiola’s BBC interview was excruciatingly awkward (Video)
thread.title_full: Man City boss Pep Guardiola’s BBC interview was excruciatingly awkward (Video)

author: Paul Morrissey
title: Man City boss Pep Guardiola’s BBC interview was excruciatingly awkward (Video)
text:
Man City boss Pep Guardiola’s BBC interview was excruciatingly awkward (Video)   Fernandinho sending off 
Without doubt, the big talking point from Man City’s win over Burnley today was the Fernandinho red card. 
The Brazilian midfielder was sent off for a two-footed tackle, which meant City had to grind out a 2-1 win with 10 men. Edgy Pep 
And it’s fair to say Pep Guardiola did not agree with the decision. 
The red card left him in foul humour, and even the 3 points couldn’t dissipate Pep’s rage. 
And in an evening of edgy press engagements for the Catalan, Pep’s BBC interview was genuinely excruciating to watch. "Pep, you don't seem happy that you've won?" How awkward is this? pic.twitter.com/JPXfIOBdKF 
— Match of the Day (@BBCMOTD) January 2, 2017 Loading tags...
